stem: A superficial laceration at the dorsum of the wrist transects the radial nerve where it is purely cutaneous. Which finding is most expected?

choices.A: Loss of wrist extension with intact sensation
choices.C: Sensory loss over lateral dorsum of hand with preserved motor function

rationale_correct: At the wrist the radial nerve contributes only cutaneous fibers; motor function is preserved.

rationale_distractors.A: Motor loss implies deeper radial motor branch involvement proximally.
rationale_distractors.B: Triceps (elbow extension) reflects a proximal/axillary radial lesion.
rationale_distractors.D: Thenar atrophy is median (recurrent motor) pathology.
rationale_distractors.E: Pronation is mediated by the median nerve (pronators).

evidence.citation: Selski D. Nerve Injuries of the Upper Limb (Slides). 2022.
